entry.title: DPM-Solver
entry.content:
DPM-Solver: A Fast ODE Solver for Diffusion

Origin Video

Github code

Denoting Diffusion Probabilistic Model (DDPM)

basic math knowledge

  • The differences between VAE and Diffusion

    • VAEs: Learn models by “searching”, both pθp_\thetapθ​ and qθq_\thetaqθ​

    • Diffusion models: Learn by “imitating” a fixed forward process qqq

  • MSE Loss

    L=12∫0Tw(t)Eq0(x0)Eq(ε)[∣∣ϵθ(xt,t)−ϵ∣∣22]dt\mathcal{L}=\frac{1}{2}\int_0^Tw(t)\mathbb{E}_{q_0(x_0)}\mathbb{E}_{q(\varepsilon)}[||\epsilon_\theta(x_t,t)-\epsilon||_2^2]dtL=21​∫0T​w(t)Eq0​(x0​)​Eq(ε)​[∣∣ϵθ​(xt​,t)−ϵ∣∣22​]dt

  • Convergence guarantee

    For large enough TTT, the reverse process is indeed Gaussian

Two Types of Diffusion Probabilistic Models

From noise to data

From SDE to ODE

Starting from the distribution q0(x0)q_0(x_0)q0​(x0​), define the distribution through the following SDE at time ttt as qt(xt)q_t(x_t)qt​(xt​)

  • Forward SDE

    dxt=f(xt,t)dt+g(t)dwtdx_t=f(x_t,t)dt+g(t)dw_tdxt​=f(xt​,t)dt+g(t)dwt​

  • Forward ODE

    dxtdt=f(xt,t)−12g(t)2∇xlog⁡qt(xt)\frac{dx_t}{dt}=f(x_t,t)-\frac{1}{2}g(t)^2\nabla_x\log q_t(x_t)dtdxt​​=f(xt​,t)−21​g(t)2∇x​logqt​(xt​), it has the same marginal distribution qt(xt)q_t(x_t)qt​(xt​) at each ttt

Summary

  • Diffusion SDEs

    dxt=[f(t)xt+g2(t)σtϵθ(xt,t)]dt+g(t)dwt‾dx_t=[f(t)x_t+\frac{g^2(t)}{\sigma_t}\epsilon_\theta(x_t,t)]dt+g(t)d\overline{w_t}dxt​=[f(t)xt​+σt​g2(t)​ϵθ​(xt​,t)]dt+g(t)dwt​​,xT∼N(0,σ‾2I)x_T\sim\mathcal{N}(0,\overline{\sigma}^2I)xT​∼N(0,σ2I)

    DDPM:first-order diffusion SDEs

    Analytic-DPM:diffusion SDEs

  • Diffusion ODEs:

    dxtdt=f(t)xt+g2(t)2σtϵθ(xt,t)\frac{dx_t}{dt}=f(t)x_t+\frac{g^2(t)}{2\sigma_t}\epsilon_\theta(x_t,t)dtdxt​​=f(t)xt​+2σt​g2(t)​ϵθ​(xt​,t),xT∼N(0,σ‾2I)x_T\sim\mathcal{N}(0,\overline{\sigma}^2I)xT​∼N(0,σ2I)

    Deterministic: no more noises, Generally faster than SDE

    Invertible: The encoded noise can be used for downstream tasks, such as inpainting

    DDIM:first-order diffusion ODEs

DPM-Solver

ODE: dxtdt=f(t)xt+g2(t)2σtϵθ(xt,t)\frac{dx_t}{dt}=f(t)x_t+\frac{g^2(t)}{2\sigma_t}\epsilon_\theta(x_t,t)dtdxt​​=f(t)xt​+2σt​g2(t)​ϵθ​(xt​,t),xT∼N(0,σ‾2I)x_T\sim\mathcal{N}(0,\overline{\sigma}^2I)xT​∼N(0,σ2I)

Where ϵθ(xt,t)\epsilon_\theta(x_t,t)ϵθ​(xt​,t) is a result of the neural network

DDPM: 200~1000 steps

DDIM: ~100 steps

Traditional Runge-Kutta

xt=xs+∫st(f(τ)xτ+g2(τ)2στϵθ(xτ,τ))⏟hθ(xt,t)dτx_t=x_s+\int_s^t\underbrace{(f(\tau)x_\tau+\frac{g^2(\tau)}{2\sigma_\tau}\epsilon_\theta(x_\tau,\tau))}_{h_\theta(x_t,t)}d\tauxt​=xs​+∫st​hθ​(xt​,t)(f(τ)xτ​+2στ​g2(τ)​ϵθ​(xτ​,τ))​​dτ

set hθ(xt,t)h_\theta(x_t,t)hθ​(xt​,t) as a “black block” function, lose the known information fff and ggg

cannot converge for <20<20<20 steps

Improvement

Totally, replace the hθ(xt,t)h_\theta(x_t,t)hθ​(xt​,t) with a more precise function

Observation1 Exactly Computing the Linear Part

The linear part f(t)xtf(t)x_tf(t)xt​ can be transformed into a certain part

by using “variation of constants” formula

⇒  xt=e∫stf(τ)dτxs⏟Exactly Computed+∫st(e∫stf(τ)dτg2(τ)2στϵθ(xτ,τ))dτ\Rightarrow\;x_t=\underbrace{e^{\int_s^tf(\tau)d\tau}x_s}_{Exactly\ Computed}+\int_s^t(e^{\int_s^tf(\tau)d\tau}\frac{g^2(\tau)}{2\sigma_\tau}\epsilon_\theta(x_\tau,\tau))d\tau⇒xt​=Exactly Computede∫st​f(τ)dτxs​​​+∫st​(e∫st​f(τ)dτ2στ​g2(τ)​ϵθ​(xτ​,τ))dτ

Observation2 Simplifying by log-SNR

Swap the variables

q0t(xt∣x0)=N(xtα(t)x0,σ2(t)I)q_{0t}(x_t|x_0)=\mathcal{N}(x_t\alpha(t)x_0,\sigma^2(t)I)q0t​(xt​∣x0​)=N(xt​α(t)x0​,σ2(t)I)

define signal-to-noise-ratio(SNR) αt2/σt2\alpha^2_t/\sigma^2_tαt2​/σt2​

Define λt:=log⁡(αt/σt)\lambda_t := \log(\alpha_t/\sigma_t)λt​:=log(αt​/σt​) (half of log-SNR)

Then we can transform fff and ggg: {f(t)=dlog⁡αtdtg2(t)=−2σt2dλtdt\left\{ \begin{array}{l} f(t)&=&\frac{d\log\alpha_t}{dt}\\g^2(t)&=&-2\sigma_t^2\frac{d\lambda_t}{dt} \end{array} \right.{f(t)g2(t)​==​dtdlogαt​​−2σt2​dtdλt​​​

by using “change-of-variable” formula

⇒  xt=αtαsxs−αt∫λsλte−λϵ^θ(x^λ,λ)dλ\Rightarrow\;x_t=\frac{\alpha_t}{\alpha_s}x_s-\alpha_t\int_{\lambda_s}^{\lambda_t}e^{-\lambda}\hat{\epsilon}_\theta(\hat{x}_\lambda,\lambda)d\lambda⇒xt​=αs​αt​​xs​−αt​∫λs​λt​​e−λϵ^θ​(x^λ​,λ)dλ

All we need to do is to approximate the exponentially weighted integral

Designing High-Order Solvers for Diffusion ODEs

Using Taylor for ϵ^θ(x^λ,λ)\hat{\epsilon}_\theta(\hat{x}_\lambda,\lambda)ϵ^θ​(x^λ​,λ)

⇒  xti−1→ti=αtiαti−1xti−1^−αti∑n=0k−1ϵ^θ(n)(x^λti−1,λti−1)⏟Derivatives∫λti−1λtie−λ(λ−λti−1)nn!dλ⏟Coefficients+O(hik+1)\Rightarrow\;x_{t_{i-1}\rightarrow t_i}=\frac{\alpha_{t_i}}{\alpha_{t_{i-1}}}\hat{x_{t_{i-1}}}-\alpha_{t_i}\sum_{n=0}^{k-1}\underbrace{\hat{\epsilon}_\theta^{(n)}(\hat{x}_{\lambda_{t_{i-1}}},\lambda_{t_{i-1}})}_{Derivatives}\underbrace{\int_{\lambda_{t_{i-1}}}^{\lambda_{t_i}}e^{-\lambda}\frac{(\lambda-\lambda_{t_{i-1}})^n}{n!}d\lambda}_{Coefficients}+O(h_i^{k+1})⇒xti−1​→ti​​=αti−1​​αti​​​xti−1​​^​−αti​​∑n=0k−1​Derivativesϵ^θ(n)​(x^λti−1​​​,λti−1​​)​​Coefficients∫λti−1​​λti​​​e−λn!(λ−λti−1​​)n​dλ​​+O(hik+1​)

Observation3 Exactly Computing the Coefficients

∫λti−1λtie−λ(λ−λti−1)nn!dλ=−∫λti−1λti(λ−λti−1)nn!d(e−λ)=(−(λ−λti−1)nn!e−λ)∣λti−1λti+∫λti−1λtie−λ(λ−λti−1)n−1(n−1)!dλ=⋯\begin{array}{l}\int_{\lambda_{t_{i-1}}}^{\lambda_{t_i}}e^{-\lambda}\frac{(\lambda-\lambda_{t_{i-1}})^n}{n!}d\lambda &=-\int_{\lambda_{t_{i-1}}}^{\lambda_{t_i}}\frac{(\lambda-\lambda_{t_{i-1}})^n}{n!}d(e^{-\lambda})\\ &=(-\frac{(\lambda-\lambda_{t_{i-1}})^n}{n!}e^{-\lambda})|_{\lambda_{t_{i-1}}}^{\lambda_{t_i}}+ \int_{\lambda_{t_{i-1}}}^{\lambda_{t_i}}e^{-\lambda}\frac{(\lambda-\lambda_{t_{i-1}})^{n-1}}{(n-1)!}d\lambda\\ &=\cdots \end{array}∫λti−1​​λti​​​e−λn!(λ−λti−1​​)n​dλ​=−∫λti−1​​λti​​​n!(λ−λti−1​​)n​d(e−λ)=(−n!(λ−λti−1​​)n​e−λ)∣λti−1​​λti​​​+∫λti−1​​λti​​​e−λ(n−1)!(λ−λti−1​​)n−1​dλ=⋯​

Repeatedly applying nnn times of integration-by-parts

Observation4 Approximating Derivatives without Autograd

ϵ^θ(1)(x^λti−1,λti−1)≈ϵ^θ(x^λsi,λsi)−ϵ^θ(x^λti−1,λti−1)λsi−λti−1\hat{\epsilon}_\theta^{(1)}(\hat{x}_{\lambda_{t_{i-1}}},\lambda_{t_{i-1}})\approx\frac{\hat{\epsilon}_\theta(\hat{x}_{\lambda_{s_i}},\lambda_{s_i})-\hat{\epsilon}_\theta(\hat{x}_{\lambda_{t_{i-1}}},\lambda_{t_{i-1}})}{\lambda_{s_i}-\lambda_{t_{i-1}}}ϵ^θ(1)​(x^λti−1​​​,λti−1​​)≈λsi​​−λti−1​​ϵ^θ​(x^λsi​​​,λsi​​)−ϵ^θ​(x^λti−1​​​,λti−1​​)​

Only function evaluation for ϵ^θ\hat{\epsilon}_\thetaϵ^θ​ without applying autograd

Summary

xti−1→ti=αtiαti−1x^ti−1⏟Linear term+αti∑n=0k−1ϵ^θ(n)(x^λti−1,λti−1)⏟Derivatives∫λti−1λtie−λ(λ−λti−1)nn!dλ⏟Coefficients+O(hik+1)⏟High−order errorsx_{t_{i-1}\rightarrow t_i}=\underbrace{\frac{\alpha_{t_i}}{\alpha_{t_{i-1}}}\hat{x}_{t_{i-1}}}_{Linear\ term}+\alpha_{t_i}\sum_{n=0}^{k-1}\underbrace{\hat{\epsilon}_\theta^{(n)}(\hat{x}_{\lambda_{t_{i-1}}},\lambda_{t_{i-1}})}_{Derivatives}\underbrace{\int_{\lambda_{t_{i-1}}}^{\lambda_{t_i}}e^{-\lambda}\frac{(\lambda-\lambda_{t_{i-1}})^n}{n!}d\lambda}_{Coefficients}+\underbrace{O(h_i^{k+1})}_{High-order\ errors}xti−1​→ti​​=Linear termαti−1​​αti​​​x^ti−1​​​​+αti​​∑n=0k−1​Derivativesϵ^θ(n)​(x^λti−1​​​,λti−1​​)​​Coefficients∫λti−1​​λti​​​e−λn!(λ−λti−1​​)n​dλ​​+High−order errorsO(hik+1​)​​

The Linear term, Corfficients both can be exactly computed, and the High-order errors can be omitted.

So we only approximate the terms about the neural network, which can lead to higher precision

If set k=2k=2k=2, then it is the same with DDIM

Result

15~20 steps

No more cost

DPM-Solver++: Fast Solver for Guided Sampling of Diffusion Probabilistic Models

(Conditional) Guided Sampling by DPMs

DPM-Solver++

entry.title: Hexo-LiveForCode
entry.content:
LiveForCode

这篇文章并非教程，配置教程建议参考主题原文LiveForCode。

  • 其他服务
    • Algolia
      export HEXO_ALGOLIA_INDEXING_KEY=<Admin API Key>
      hexo algolia --flush true --layouts post
    • Vercel
      基本不需要更新吧应该(
    • Valine(LearnCloud)
      管理评论

entry.title: Markdown和个人知识库
entry.content:
Markdown和个人知识库

  1. Markdown
    1. 什么是Markdown
      1. Html与Markdown的关系
      2. Markdown的组成形式和展示形式
    2. 为什么要用Markdown
      1. 轻量
      2. 拓展性好
      3. 部分特别能力
    3. 怎么写Markdown
      1. 原生Markdown
      2. 编辑器书写Markdown
        1. Typora等特殊Markdown编辑器
        2. Vscode等代码编辑器
        3. 语雀/飞书等在线编辑器
        4. 其他（github）
    4. 扩展内容
      1. 如何写一份好看的Markdown
      2. Markdown与Latex，以及其Latex支持
      3. 在Markdown中使用Html语法
      4. 关于Typora
  2. 个人知识库
    1. 个人知识库是什么
    2. 为什么要个人知识库
      1. 信息整合
      2. 信息分享
    3. 如何构建个人知识库
      1. 构建目标
      2. 组成部分
  3. Markdown与个人知识库综合
    1. 构建位置
      1. github
      2. 语雀等在线编辑器
      3. 个人网站
    2. 构建方式（为什么要用Markdown）
  4. 杂谈
    1. Typora与语雀的利弊
    2. 为什么现在讲这个
    3. 一些例子分享
entry.summary:
Markdown和个人知识库

  1. Markdown
    1. 什么是Markdown
